title: What are the features of the fax machines? - Quora

response.answer_text: An electrical power cord with plug compatible with location.A paper supply.A means of connecting the machine to a landline telephone line.A pair of rollers to move one sheet of paper.A means of printing on the sheet of paper.Electronic circuitry to accept the incoming electrical signals and translate them into electrical signals that control the process of printing on the paper.A storage tray to hold a supply of blank paper.A storage tray to accept the printed pages.In some machines an bell or a speaker that makes a noise when all incoming pages have been printed and are ready for pickup.In some machines an bell or a speaker that makes a noise when all outbound pages have been sent.In some machines an bell or a speaker that makes a noise when the machine needs human attention due to a problem (e.g. out of paper, paper jam, printer failure).Some machines have dust covers that can be placed over the machine when not in use for an extended period of time (e.g. overnight, weekend).Some sort of tag that indicates the name of the manufacturer, the model andserial numbers of the machine, and the name and contact information for the manufacturer.Above comments may not apply to all fax machines.
